snippet: The forecasts have long been issued in all capital letters, but in the Internet age, those messages can look hysterical. Next month, the service will adopt mixed-case lettering.
abstract: National Weather Service will begin disseminating bulk of its forecasts in mixed-case lettering, changing from current use of all capital letters, practice that began in 1849; agency hopes change will make its forecasts, particularly severe weather warnings, more professional and effective on digital devices.
lead_paragraph: The forecasts have long been issued in all capital letters, but in the Internet age, those messages can look hysterical. Next month, the service will adopt mixed-case lettering.

headline.main: National Weather Service: Forecasts ‘Will Stop Yelling at You’
headline.print_headline: National Weather Service Forecasts Will No Longer Scream in All Capital Letters
